meanings.definition: Failure to act when there is a duty to do so.
meanings.sent1: Her nonfeasances in helping her friend with homework disappointed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The company was sued for their nonfeasances in maintaining workplace safety standards.
meanings.sent3: The nonfeasances of the sleepy cat in catching the mouse led to a comical chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: His nonfeasances in keeping his promises turned his words into empty echoes.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of nonfeasances in fire safety can be devastating.

meanings.definition: The state of not performing an act that one is legally obligated to do.
meanings.sent1: The nonfeasances of the landlord in fixing the leaky roof caused damage to the tenant's belongings.
meanings.sent2: Legal action was taken against the accountant for his nonfeasances in filing the tax returns.
meanings.sent3: The nonfeasances of the forgetful student in submitting the assignment on time resulted in a lower grade.
meanings.sent4: The nonfeasances of the negligent driver in following traffic rules led to a serious accident.
meanings.sent5: The concept of nonfeasances is crucial in understanding legal responsibilities.
